greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of symmetrically unique Dyck paths of semilength n and height k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(x, y, k) option remember; `if`(x=0, z^k, `if`(y<x-1,
g:= proc(x, y, k) option remember; `if`(x=0, z^k, `if`(y>0,
mathematica: T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, z, i]/2, {i, 0, n}]][b[2*n, 0, 0] + g[2*n, 0, 0]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 03 2018, from Maple *)
program: from sympy import Poly, Symbol, flatten
def b(x, y, k): return z**k if x==0 else (b(x - 1, y + 1, max(y + 1, k)) if y<x - 1 else 0) + (b(x - 1, y - 1, k) if y>0 else 0)
def g(x, y, k): return z**k if x==0 else (g(x - 2, y - 1, k) if y>0 else 0) + g(x - 2, y + 1, max(y + 1, k))
def T(n): return 1 if n==0 else [i//2 for i in Poly(b(2*n, 0, 0) + g(2*n, 0, 0)).all_coeffs()[::-1]]
xref: Main and first two lower diagonals give A000012, A001477, A028387(n-1) for n>0.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 05 2017
